holidays.name: Juneteenth
holidays.description: Celebrates the emancipation of the last remaining enslaved African Americans in the United States on June 19, 1865.
holidays.origin: Derived from the combination of 'June' and 'nineteenth,' marking when Union soldiers arrived in Galveston, Texas, to announce freedom.
holidays.funFact: Juneteenth is the oldest nationally celebrated commemoration of the ending of slavery in the U.S. and was declared a federal holiday in 2021.

holidays.name: National Garfield the Cat Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate everyone's favorite lasagna-loving, Monday-hating orange cat created by Jim Davis.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the premiere of the Garfield comic strip which started in 1978.
holidays.funFact: Garfield holds the Guinness World Record for being the most widely syndicated comic strip in the world.

holidays.name: International Day for the Elimination of Sexual Violence in Conflict
holidays.description: Raised global awareness about the need to end sexual violence during armed conflicts.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2015 to commemorate the 2012 murder of peace activist and Nobel laureate Bangura.
holidays.funFact: This day honors courage and dedication of survivors and advocates working towards peace and justice in conflict zones.

holidays.name: National Martini Day
holidays.description: A spirited celebration of the classic cocktail traditionally made with gin and vermouth and garnished with an olive or lemon twist.
holidays.origin: Origin debated, but the martini became popular in the early 20th century, and this day honors its timeless sophistication.
